newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks rebound, end sharply up.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks rebound, end sharply up.

text.p: Pakistani stocks rebounded to end sharply up on Thursday in renewed buying of blue chips before the Friday-Saturday weekend and are likely to open higher on Sunday, dealers said.
The Karachi Stock Exchange (KSE) 100-share index ended 22.71 points, or 1.59 percent, up at 1,449.55 amid 114 gainers and 112 losers. Volume rose to 30 million shares from Wednesday's 22 million.
Buoyant sentiment in PTCL, HUBCO, Fauji Fertiliser and Dewan Salman Fibre due to covering of short positions led to a smart recovery, dealer Asif Jan said.
"Fresh selective buying by local institutions has indeed revived the sentiment," he said.

Pakistan Refinery jumped 13 rupees to 66, Adamjee Insurance 4.50 to 94, General Tyre 3.50 to 24, HUBCO 1.55 to 30.70, PTCL 0.95 to 36, Fauji Fertiliser 1.85 to 74.75, Dewan Salman 0.50 to 27 and Sui Southern Gas 1.50 to 29. PSO fell 4.00 to 331.
